org.epochx.life
Interface GenerationListener

All Known Implementing Classes:
GenerationAdapter
public interface GenerationListener

Provides the interface to be implemented by objects that wish to handle generation events. See the GenerationManager's class documentation for details of when each generation event will be fired. To listen for generation events during execution of a model, instances of GenerationListener must be added to the model's LifeCycleManager which is retrievable through a call to the model's getLifeCycleManager() method.

It is typical to listen to events using an anonymous class which often makes the abstract GenerationAdapter class more convenient to implement.

See Also:
GenerationAdapter, GenerationManager

Method Detail

onGenerationStart

void onGenerationStart()
Event fired before a generation starts.

onGeneration

java.util.List<CandidateProgram> onGeneration(java.util.List<CandidateProgram> pop)
Event fired after a generation has been carried out. The resultant population may be modified and returned. This event is revertable by returning null which will trigger the population to be discarded and for the whole generation to be performed again from the previous population. This event will then be raised again. If the generation should be accepted then the population should be returned as it is.

Parameters:
pop - the population that is the result of carrying out the generation.
Returns:
the list of programs that should become the next population, or null if the generation should be reverted.

onGenerationEnd

void onGenerationEnd()
Event fired once a generation has ended and been accepted.
